name: Scotti
overview: Scotti is is a single-screen platform game for the Commodore 64. It was developed by Rainer Disser and published in Computronic 1985/11-12. What a fright Scotti's birthday evening he notices his house being haunted by ghosts. This is an incomprehensible situation for our little hero. But; Scotti acts quickly: he gathers whatever household effects he can find, hops down corridors, and rides the elevator to freedom. It is therefore necessary to smuggle Scotti out of the house undamaged using the joystick. Time is against him. So hurry up and collect as much as you can. Don't forget the washing machine either! You can use the joystick to move "your" Scotti: in addition to walking directions, Scotti can perform a small jump (fire button) and a large jump (fire button and forwards). Once in the elevator, he can either go up or down The game has six different images with high-resolution graphics. The remaining time is displayed at the top of the screen. Bonus points are awarded for unused time. A total of five Scottis are available to the inclined player to make the game successful. And now let's get started: SCOTTI is already waiting for you!
